The statement made by Rep: Teresa Tanzi, D-South Kingstown, declaring that "We have no idea what is contained in that vapor" when an e-cigarette is used.
Dr: Michael Siegel, a professor in the Department of Community Health Sciences at the Boston University School of Health, co-authored a definitive academic paper in 2010 that reviewed the available science on e-cigarettes.
The studies cited by Dr: Siegel concluded that the primary components of e-cigarette vapor are propylene glycol, vegetable glycerin, and nicotine, with trace amounts of cancer-causing ingredients also detected.
